newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Jakarta fire burns out part of bank bulding.
newsitem.headline: Jakarta fire burns out part of bank bulding.

text.p: A fire which started around dawn burned out three floors of a five-storey building used by a bank and a school in the Kota area of Jakarta on Thursday, police said.
They said the fire in a Bank Negara Indonesia building apparently started as a result of a short circuit on the third floor and gutted the top three floors. They said the fire was under control.
Police said the building was used by the bank and a school.
They said there was no suggestion the fire was connected with Indonesia's general elections being held on Thursday.

The Japanese embassy was evacuated after a hoax bomb threat on Wednesday and official sources said there had been other bomb threats and rumours of threats in the city early in the week after the most violent election campaign in three decades.
